Title: Three of France's four LNG import terminals come offline for a week amid national strike
Description: Three out of the four LNG import terminals in France are offline for a week amid a national strike affecting multiple sectors in the country. The terminals affected represent over 60% of the French LNG import capacity. LNG is essential for the security of supply of France and its regional neighbours.
Author: DE

Title: Netherlands’ Eemshaven LNG terminal extends unplanned capacity restrictions
Description: The Netherlands’ 5.9 mtpa Eemshaven LNG import terminal has extended unplanned capacity restrictions almost halving its send-out capacity until Mar. 9. The terminal was launched in September to boost the country’s security of supply after Russia cut pipeline supplies to the Netherlands and several other EU countries.
Author: DE

Title: ACER to include 10-day old transactions in its daily EU LNG price assessment
Description: The European Union's Agency for the Cooperation of Energy Regulators (ACER) will start including up to 10-weekday old transactions in its daily LNG price assessment from Mar. 8. The assessment was launched in January to improve transparency on the price of LNG imports into the EU and complement the region's historic gas benchmark, the Dutch TTF.
Author: DE

Title: US regulator seeks more information from Freeport LNG to approve full restart
Description: US energy regulator the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission has asked US LNG producer Freeport LNG for more information relating to steps taken to restart operations and the conditions at its 15 mtpa LNG plant on Quintana Island, Texas, before it will approve a full restart of operations.
Author: CK

Title: Gunvor signs initial deal to buy 2 mtpa of LNG over 15 years from Chesapeake Energy
Description: Gunvor has agreed an initial deal to buy 2 mtpa of LNG over 15 years from major US gas producer Chesapeake Energy, with the US liquefaction plant where the LNG will be delivered to be determined once the deal is finalised.
Author: CK
